reactor.io.buffer

Class Buffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.io.buffer.Buffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Comparable<Buffer>, Iterable<Byte>, Channel, ReadableByteChannel, WritableByteChannel, Recyclable

    @NotThreadSafe
public class Buffer
extends Object
implements Recyclable, Comparable<Buffer>, Iterable<Byte>, ReadableByteChannel, WritableByteChannel
    A Buffer is a general-purpose IO utility class that wraps a ByteBuffer. It provides optional dynamic expansion of the buffer to accommodate additional content. It also provides convenience methods for operating on buffers.
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Buffer.View
      A View represents a segment of a buffer.

      Create a Buffer using the given ByteBuffer as the inital source.
      Buffer(int atLeast, boolean fixed)
      Create an Buffer that has an internal ByteBuffer allocated to the given size and optional make this buffer fixed-length.

    • Field Detail

      • SMALL_BUFFER_SIZE

        public static int SMALL_BUFFER_SIZE
        The size, in bytes, of a small buffer. Can be configured using the reactor.io.defaultBufferSize system property. Default to 16384 bytes.

      • MAX_BUFFER_SIZE

        public static int MAX_BUFFER_SIZE
        The maximum allowed buffer size in bytes. Can be configured using the reactor.io.maxBufferSize system property. Defaults to 16384000 bytes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Buffer

        public Buffer()
        Create an empty Buffer that is dynamic.

      • Buffer

        public Buffer(int atLeast,
              boolean fixed)
        Create an Buffer that has an internal ByteBuffer allocated to the given size and optional make this buffer fixed-length.
        Parameters:
        atLeast - Allocate this many bytes immediately.
        fixed - true to make this buffer fixed-length, false otherwise.

        Returns:
        The new Buffer.

      • wrap

        public static Buffer wrap(String str,
                          boolean fixed)
        Convenience method to create a new Buffer from the given String and optionally specify whether the new Buffer should be a fixed length or not.
        Parameters:
        str - The String to create a buffer from.
        fixed - true to create a fixed-length Buffer, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Buffer.

        Returns:
        The new fixed-length Buffer.

      • parseInt

        public static Integer parseInt(Buffer b,
                               int start,
                               int end)
        Very efficient method for parsing an Integer from the given Buffer range. Much faster than Integer.parseInt(String).
        Parameters:
        b - The Buffer to slice.
        start - start of the range.
        end - end of the range.
        Returns:
        The int value or null if the Buffer could not be read.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The int value or null if the Buffer could not be read.

        public List<Buffer.View> split(int delimiter)
        Split this buffer on the given delimiter.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter on which to split this buffer.
        Returns:

      • split

        public List<Buffer.View> split(List<Buffer.View> views,
                               int delimiter)
        Split this buffer on the given delimiter but save memory by reusing the given List.
        Parameters:
        views - The list to store Views in.
        delimiter - The delimiter on which to split this buffer.
        Returns:
        A List of Views that point to the segments of this buffer.

      • split

        public List<Buffer.View> split(int delimiter,
                               boolean stripDelimiter)
        Split this buffer on the given delimiter and optionally leave the delimiter intact rather than stripping it.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter on which to split this buffer.
        stripDelimiter - true to ignore the delimiter, false to leave it in the returned data.
        Returns:
        A List of Views that point to the segments of this buffer.

      • split

        public List<Buffer.View> split(List<Buffer.View> views,
                               int delimiter,
                               boolean stripDelimiter)
        Split this buffer on the given delimiter, save memory by reusing the given List, and optionally leave the delimiter intact rather than stripping it.
        Parameters:
        views - The list to store Views in.
        delimiter - The delimiter on which to split this buffer.
        stripDelimiter - true to ignore the delimiter, false to leave it in the returned data.
        Returns:
        A List of Views that point to the segments of this buffer.

      • split

        public Iterable<Buffer.View> split(Buffer delimiter)
        Split this buffer on the given delimiter and leave the delimiter on the end of each segment.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - the multi-byte delimiter
        Returns:
        An Iterable of Views that point to the segments of this buffer.

      • split

        public Iterable<Buffer.View> split(Buffer delimiter,
                                   boolean stripDelimiter)
        Split this buffer on the given delimiter. The delimiter is stripped from the end of the segment if stripDelimiter is true.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The multi-byte delimiter.
        stripDelimiter - true to ignore the delimiter, false to leave it in the returned data.
        Returns:
        An Iterable of Views that point to the segments of this buffer.

      • split

        public Iterable<Buffer.View> split(List<Buffer.View> views,
                                   Buffer delimiter,
                                   boolean stripDelimiter)
        Split this buffer on the given delimiter. Save memory by reusing the provided List. The delimiter is stripped from the end of the segment if stripDelimiter is true.
        Parameters:
        views - The already-allocated List to reuse.
        delimiter - The multi-byte delimiter.
        stripDelimiter - true to ignore the delimiter, false to leave it in the returned data.
        Returns:
        An Iterable of Views that point to the segments of this buffer.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte b)
        Search the buffer and find the position of the first occurrence of the given byte.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte to search for
        Returns:
        the position of the char in the buffer or -1 if not found

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte b,
                   int start,
                   int end)
        Search the buffer and find the position of the first occurrence of the given byte staring at the start position and searching until (and including) the end position.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte to search for
        start - the position to start searching
        end - the position at which to stop searching
        Returns:
        the position of the char in the buffer or -1 if not found

      • slice

        public List<Buffer.View> slice(int... positions)
        Slice this buffer at the given positions. Useful for extracting multiple segments of data from a buffer when the exact indices of that data is already known.
        Parameters:
        positions - The start and end positions of the slices.
        Returns:
        A list of Views pointing to the slices.
